# FLUXIA-CLASS CHEMISTRY SHUTTLE
[color=#a4885c]Ship Size:[/color] Medium
[color=#a4885c]Recommended Crew:[/color] 2-4
[color=#a4885c]Power Gen Type:[/color] Uranium
[color=#a4885c]Expeditions:[/color] None
[color=#a4885c]IFF Console:[/color] None
"A small-to-medium, chemistry-focused shuttle for 2 chemists, with their laboratories, and a garden with botanical supplies."
# PREFLIGHT CHECKLIST
## 1. Power supply
## 1.1. Battery units
- Check that the S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the SMES unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the substation unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the main APC unit's Main Breaker is toggled on. - Check the APC unit's current Load* (W).
## 1.2. S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit.
- Check that the generator unit is properly anchored. - Check that the generator unit is connected to the cable terminal of your SMES via HV. - Check the fuel remaining in the generator unit. - Set the generator unit output power to 22 kW. - Enable Injection.
## 2. Atmospherics
## 2.1. Distribution Loop
- Ensure that an air canister is connected to the connector port. - Check that the air canister is of a suitable atmos mixture (~21% oxygen, ~79% nitrogen). - Enable the gas pump into the distribution system.
## 3. Other checks
- Check that the gyroscope is anchored, powered, and enabled. - Check that the mini gravity generator is anchored, powered, and enabled.
## Sidenotes
* - Fluxia-class chemistry shuttles are equipped with one APC unit that can be used to appraise the ship's total power consumption. An unmodified Fluxia-class ship requires ~25.7 kW of power to remain operational.
# SHUTTLE DETAILS
## 1. Overall
The shuttle has integral pressure, fire, air, resistance; being [color=red]equipped with fire doors, alarms, and safety equipment[/color], but also shutters in case of manipulating hazardous chemicals. This shuttle was built by Dark Matter Enterprises, with the word safety in front of everything.
## 2. Top of the shuttle
## 2.1. Cockpit
Armed with a [color=#334E6D]fax machine[/color], [color=#334E6D]the shuttle console[/color], [color=#334E6D] the station records[/color], paper, a pen and even a cell recharger, this cockpit is not to be mixed up with an office cubicle. A [color=#334E6D]holopad[/color] as well as two racks and a chair are present too.
## 2.2. Power Closet
Powered with two S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N.-type portable generators, a substation but also a SMES unit, in order to achieve a maximum delay between power outage, this shuttle is eco-friendly with its uranium-fueled power.
## 2.3. Safety Closet
This closet is the home to your air distribution, but also houses crude cleaning equipement. It also has a fire closet and a radiation suit closet for any hazardous chemical incidents.
## 2.4. Hall
In the hall of the shuttle, you can find your emergency equipments: fire extinguisher, defibrillator, APC, but also a water cooler so you can hydrate in an emergency!
## 3. Chemistry Labs
Two opposed chemistry labs, entirely independant on their own, for those extremely focus crews. They are both equipped with a ChemMaster, a filled ChemDispenser, hotplate, grinder, electrolysis, a filled locker, a sink and a drain. It is also equipped with paper and a chair, as well as the periodic table just to be safe.
## 4. Garden
Equipped with seven trays, this garden allows any hydroponic dream you might have. This garden is also supplied with 3 buckets, a water tank, a NutriMax vendor, HyDrobe vendor, a MegaSeed Servitor, a seed extractor, a filled locker of botanist supplies, and a grinder alongside a beaker.
## 5. Dock
In the dock, you will find, two EVA suits, two emergency internal closets, and two spots reserved for crates/canisters.
